trans-unit.source: Provides design-time support in a visual designer for the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.SqlDataSource"></xref> control.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.SqlDataSourceDesigner"></xref> class.
Gets a value indicating whether the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.SqlDataSourceDesigner.Configure*> method can be called by the design host.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the design host supports the <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.Data.IDataEnvironment"></xref> interface; otherwise <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets a value indicating whether the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.SqlDataSourceDesigner.RefreshSchema*> method can be called by the design host.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.SqlDataSourceDesigner.ConnectionString*> and <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.SqlDataSourceDesigner.SelectCommand*> properties are not empty; otherwise <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Launches the data source configuration utility in the design host.
Gets or sets the string used to open a database.
The ConnectionString property shadows the same property in the associated control, and is intended for internal use only.
The string used to open a database connection at runtime.
Creates a new <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.SqlDesignerDataSourceView"></xref> instance using the specified name.
<xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.SqlDesignerDataSourceView>
The name of the view to create.
An <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.SqlDesignerDataSourceView"></xref> object.
Gets or sets the <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.SqlDataSourceDesigner"></xref> that supports delete queries.
For this implementation, setting the DeleteQuery property has no effect.
The DeleteQuery property shadows the same property in the associated control, and is intended for internal use only.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataSourceOperation"></xref> query.
Derives the parameters from the specified SQL command and adds corresponding <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter"></xref> objects to the command's parameters collection.
The name of the data provider.
A <xref href="System.Data.Common.DbCommand"></xref> object.
Gets the connection string that is valid at design time for the control that is associated with this designer.
A connection string.
Retrieves a <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerDataSourceView"></xref> object that is identified by the view name.
The name of the view to get.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerDataSourceView"></xref> object if found in the data source; otherwise <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
Gets a list of available views.
A string array containing the names of the available views.
Returns an array of parameters using the specified connection, command text, and command type.
A <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.Data.DesignerDataConnection"></xref> object.
The text of the command.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.SqlDataSourceCommandType"></xref> indicating the type of command.
An array of <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter"></xref> objects.
Gets or sets the <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.SqlDataSourceDesigner"></xref> that supports insert queries.
For this implementation, setting the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.SqlDataSourceDesigner.DeleteQuery%2A> property has no effect.
The InsertQuery property in the designer shadows the same property in the associated control, and is intended for internal use only.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataSourceOperation"></xref> query.
Used by the designer to add properties to, or remove them from, the **Properties** grid or to shadow properties of the associated control.
The properties to be filtered.
Gets or sets the name of the .NET Framework data provider that the associated <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.SqlDataSource"></xref> control uses to connect to an underlying data source.
The ProviderName property shadows the same property in the associated control, and is intended for internal use only.
A string containing the name of the data provider.
Refreshes the schema from the underlying data source.
The RefreshSchema method will be called by the design host only if <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.SqlDataSourceDesigner.CanRefreshSchema%2A> is `true`.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> to suppress all data source events until the schema is refreshed; otherwise, false.
Gets or sets the SQL query in the associated <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.SqlDataSource"></xref> for selecting data from the underlying database.
The SelectCommand property shadows the same property in the associated control, and is intended for internal use only.
An SQL query.
Gets or sets the <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.SqlDataSourceDesigner"></xref> that supports select queries.
For this implementation, setting the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.SqlDataSourceDesigner.DeleteQuery%2A> property has no effect.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.SqlDataSourceDesigner.ProviderName%2A> property shadows the same property in the associated control, and is intended for internal use only.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataSourceOperation"></xref> query.
Gets or sets the <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.SqlDataSourceDesigner"></xref> that supports update queries.
For this implementation, setting the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.SqlDataSourceDesigner.DeleteQuery%2A> property has no effect.
The UpdateQuery property shadows the same property in the associated control, and is intended for internal use only.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataSourceOperation"></xref> query.
